str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To run together again. From epi and suntrecho; to hasten together upon one place.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unclean, impure. Impure (lewd) or specially, (demonic).
Wind, breath, spirit.
(lit: blunted) dumb, dull, deaf. From kopto; blunted, i.e. of hearing or speech.
And, even, also, namely.
Unable to speak or articulate; speechless. Mute.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To give order, command, charge. From epi and tasso; to arrange upon, i.e. Order.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
And, even, also, namely.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
